findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, and overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract is using variables that initialize them only in the constructor and are not defined as `immutable`. This can be optimized by declaring them as immutable to reduce storage and computation required by the contract, making it more gas-efficient.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The Solidity style guide recommends adhering to a set of guidelines for writing clean and consistent Solidity code, including using camelCase for function and variable names, PascalCase for contract, struct, and enum names, uppercase for constant variables and enums, and following indentation and spacing conventions.

findings.title: L05 - Unused State Variable
findings.description: An unused state variable is a state variable that is declared in the contract but is never used in any of the contract's functions.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract. They are often used to notify external parties or clients about events that have occurred within the contract, such as the transfer of tokens or the completion of a task.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause a loss of precision.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured with user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The version lock is a mechanism that allows the author to specify a minimum version of the Solidity compiler that must be used to compile the contract code.
